title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.37 - Initial processing by director
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.37 - Initial processing by director

State Regulations
(a) Initial review. After a charge is filed, the director of PEPR
shall conduct a review of the charge to determine whether the facts as alleged
fall within the jurisdiction of the board under the FLFLPA and whether the
facts as pleaded support an unfair labor practice charge as set forth in
section 704 or 704-b of SERA. If the director of PEPR determines that the
pleaded facts do no support such a charge, or that the charge is so vague that
the respondent could not reasonably respond to the charge, the director may
permit the party to amend the charge to cure such deficiency. Any motions by
the parties will be filed subsequent to a case conference with the assigned
hearing officer. (b) Notice
of conference. A notice of conference shall be prepared by the
director or a designated hearing officer specifying the time and place for the
conference and, together with a copy of the charge, shall be served
electronically upon the charging party and each named respondent. Notes

263.37

Adopted

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
